title: Spectral Theorem for Symmetric Matrices
contentHtml: In this worked example, we'll apply the Spectral Theorem to a symmetric matrix and diagonalize it.
statementHtml: Given the symmetric matrix A = [[1, 2], [2, 4]], diagonalize it using the Spectral Theorem.
hints: Hint: Start by finding the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of A.
problemHtml: Given the symmetric matrix A = [[1, 2], [2, 4]], diagonalize it using the Spectral Theorem.
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Find the characteristic polynomial of A.", "mathHtml": "\\[\\det(A - \\lambda I) = (1-\\lambda)^2 - 4 = 0\\]", "explanation": "We want to find the eigenvalues of A."}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Factor the characteristic polynomial.", "mathHtml": "\\[\\det(A - \\lambda I) = ((1-\\lambda) + 2)((1-\\lambda) - 2) = 0\\]", "explanation": "This helps us find the eigenvalues."}, {"stepNumber": 3, "description": "Find the eigenvectors corresponding to each eigenvalue.", "mathHtml": "\\[A \\begin{bmatrix} x \\\\ y \\end{bmatrix} = \\lambda \\begin{bmatrix} x \\\\ y \\end{bmatrix}\\]", "explanation": "We want to find the directions in which A stretches or shrinks."}, {"stepNumber": 4", "description": "Orthogonalize the eigenvectors.", "mathHtml": "\\[\\begin{bmatrix} x_1 & x_2 \\end{bmatrix} \\begin{bmatrix} y_1 \\\\ y_2 \\end{bmatrix} = 0\\]", "explanation": "This ensures that the eigenvectors are orthogonal."}, {"stepNumber": 5", "description": "Assemble the diagonal matrix.", "mathHtml": "\\[D = \\begin{bmatrix} \\lambda_1 & 0 \\\\ 0 & \\lambda_2 \\end{bmatrix}\\]", "explanation": "We can now represent A as a product of D and an orthogonal matrix U."} ],
realWorldApplications: In machine learning, symmetric matrices can represent covariance or similarity between data points.
